intro: Guettardella foveolata, commonly known as the small-leafed guettardella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually oval or elliptical in shape. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Guettardella foveolata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
